results.title: On the waves of the Adriatic
results.creator_credit: Brian McKenzie and Brian McKenzie Film Productions
results.brief_description: Melbourne filmmaker Brian McKenzie spent 5 years working on this engrossing study of a not-so-typical Brunswick household. McKenzie plays a central part as he documents the lifestyle of Graham (a youth in his 20’s), his family and friends. After having spent so long with the family, McKenzie becomes part of the furniture- a situation which enables him to dig deep into the subjects’ lives.

results.title: Stories of Rippon Lea Estate
results.brief_description:
Melbourne’s historic Rippon Lea Estate is one of the fabulous locations used in the popular ‘Miss Fisher’ television series. It has also been the venue for an exhibition of the costumes from the series.
Here, staff of the National Trust of Australia (Victoria), who manage the property, talk about its history, its use as a filming location, and the relationship between the producers of the series, the National Trust, and the enthusiastic audiences for the series who have also visited Rippon Lea and the exhibition.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Hispano Suiza
results.creator_credit: Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description:
Learn more about the luxury motor car that appears in the series, Phryne’s red ‘Hispano-Suiza’.
One of the luxury cars of the 1920s, the ‘Hispano-Suiza’ was favoured by royalty, film stars and moguls. The name means “Spanish Swiss”, but the car was manufactured in France, as explained by its owner, Bob, who spent twelve years restoring what had been “just a heap of rusty bits”. His successful restoration adds an authentic glamour to Phryne’s motoring.

results.title: Filming Miss Fisher at the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Tim Entwisle, Director and CEO of the Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne, introduces the history of the Gardens and Observatory buildings, discussing their initial development in the ‘Marvellous Melbourne’ of the gold rush, and their place in Melbourne’s social and intellectual life.
Tim also recounts the story of the infamous serial killings that took place in the Gardens in the 1920s.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries: Murder on the Ballarat train  (Series 01. Ep. 02)
results.creator_credit: Kate Dennis, Fiona Eagger, Deb Cox, Screen Australia and Every Cloud Productions
results.brief_description: The glamorous Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis), accompanied by her maid Dot, decide to travel to the country by train to collect her new Hispano-Suiza motor car.The charm of rail travel soon evaporates though, when Phryne unexpectedly has to use her trusty pearl-handled pistol to save a young woman’s life and solve the disappearance of her fellow passenger’s mother. Her train trip derailed by a gruesome murder, Phryne speeds home in her Hispano-Suiza to her new abode in St Kilda where she works through the clues until she discovers her unassuming murderer. [Source: Every Cloud Productions]

results.title: Ivanhoe
results.creator_credit: Stuart Orme, Jeremy Gwilt, A&E Television Networks and BBC
results.brief_description: Sir Walter Scotts novel adapted by Deborah Cook is a superb epic. A story set in England in 1192 of a Saxon knight who returns from the crusades to find that life is not the same as as before he left. His beloved - the fair Rowena - is now engaged to Athelstane Prince of the Saxons, his father has disowned him therefore he has no inheritance and his honour is besmirched by false rumours about his actions in Palestine. All these trials he needs to overcome, at the same time as he attempts to save the lovely Jewess, Rebecca, from the hands of a misguided Norman knight who feels that his soul is in peril by loving her. A great adventure story of knights, quests, chivalry, courage, honour, sword- fights and a love story to boot. A superb cast headed by Steven Waddington, Ciaren Hinds, Susan Lynch, Victoria Smurfit, James Cosmo and Christopher Lee.

results.title: Ivan the Terrible: part 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sergei Eisenstein, Alma-Ata Studios and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: This film is the second part of a trilogy that was not completed. Although filmed shortly after Part One in 1946, the film was suppressed and was not released until 1958. It is also the last film Eisenstein made. In the trilogy Eisenstein planned to show the inner struggle of the first Czar of Russia and founder of the Russian state, in his effort to consolidate the unity of the realm against its enemies at home - the boyars or feudal noblemen - and neighbouring powers. Part Two takes up the story of Ivan the Terrible (Nikolai Cherkasov) upon his return to Moscow from Alexandrov. The complex story is full of intrigue, high level political in-fighting, family resentment and suspicion, and assassination plot, executions and murder in the cathedral. Two reels of the original were filmed in colour. The banquet scene towards the end of the film was Eisenstein’s first use of colour stock. In Russian with English subtitles. Cast includes Serafima Birman, Pavel Kadochnikov, Mikhail Zharov, Vsevolod Pudovkin. Original music by Sergei Prokofiev and cinematography by Andrei Moskvin, Eduard Tisse.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Melbourne: Before and After Visual Effects
results.brief_description: This short work shows how digital special effects are employed to capture ‘before’ and ‘after’ shots to make 2015 Melbourne appear as 1920s Melbourne. These have been produced for ‘Behind the Scenes’ of the series produced by Every Cloud Productions shown on ABC television ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’.
results.title_for_label: Miss Fisher’s Melbourne: Before and After Visual Effects
results.description: This short work shows how digital special effects are employed to capture ‘before’ and ‘after’ shots to make 2015 Melbourne appear as 1920s Melbourne. These have been produced for ‘Behind the Scenes’ of the series produced by Every Cloud Productions shown on ABC television ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’.

results.title: Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries
results.brief_description:
Venture into the opulent world of Melbourne in the 1920s and enjoy episodes of the ABC TV series ‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’.

‘Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries’ focuses on the personal and professional life of Phryne Fisher (Essie Davis), a private detective in 1920s Melbourne.

This Australian television mystery drama is based on Kerry Greenwood’s ‘Phryne Fisher Murder Mystery’ novels and was created by Deb Cox and Fiona Eagger. Premiering on 24th February 2012 with the pilot episode ‘Cocaine Blues’, its popularity saw a third series produced and screened in May 2015.

results.title: Ivan the Terrible: part 1 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sergei Eisenstein, Alma-Ata Studios and Mosfilm
results.brief_description: Ivan the Terrible part I is Eisenstein’s boldest and most successful experiment in stylisation drawing upon other arts - Wagnerian opera, Marinsky ballet and Japanese Kabuki theatre - which he had begun in “Alexander Nevsky”. Ivan’s personal life is interwoven with the themes of his drive for empire and his alliance with the merchant class against the aristocracy. It is the first part of a trilogy; part 2 is dominated by cloak-and-dagger intrigue; part 3 which was to be in colour, was designed but not filmed. Cast includes Nikolai Cherkasov and Ludmila Tselikovskaya.
